job_description:
Business Analyst

The Business Analyst plays a key role in ensuring requirements are clearly understood, accurately documented, and traceable throughout the software development lifecycle. This role focuses on translating business and functional inputs into structured, standardized documentation that supports effective development, testing, and delivery. Working closely with business analysts, design teams, and technical stakeholders, the role ensures consistency, clarity, and alignment across all requirement artifacts.

Key Responsibilities

  • Create Software Requirement Specifications (SRS) based on inputs from Core Business Analysts, stakeholder discussions, and requirement walkthroughs
  • Prepare Business Requirement Documents (BRD) using approved templates while ensuring business intent and system behavior are clearly documented
  • Participate in requirement discussions to understand business objectives, functional flows, dependencies, and assumptions before documentation
  • Analyze requirements to identify gaps, ambiguities, and inconsistencies, and work with Core BAs to resolve them
  • Document functional flows, business rules, and acceptance criteria where applicable to support development and QA teams
  • Document wireframes, UI flows, validations, and UI specifications in collaboration with design and product teams
  • Maintain change logs, version history, and document updates throughout the project lifecycle
  • Create and manage traceability matrices linking business, functional, and technical requirements
  • Maintain cross-references across BRD, SRS, UI, API, and related documentation
  • Ensure documentation consistency, completeness, and alignment with approved scope and delivery timelines
  • Ensure accurate and timely PMS updates with structured documentation details
  • Support development, QA, UAT, and audit processes through clear, traceable, and up-to-date documentation
  • Assist in requirement reviews, walkthroughs, and validation sessions with internal and client stakeholders

Requirements

Required Skills and Experience - 2 to 5 years of experience in Business Analysis documentation or related roles - Strong experience in BRD and SRS creation - Hands-on experience with documentation templates, standards, and version control - Ability to document UI wireframes and functional flows clearly - Working knowledge of APIs and system integrations for documentation purposes - Experience with project management systems and documentation tools - Strong attention to detail and ability to manage multiple documents in parallel - Excellent written communication and stakeholder coordination skills

Minimum Qualifications - Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field

Benefits

A growth-driven environment with opportunities to lead, innovate, and upskill continuously.

Contact: For inquiries, email your resume to careers@2basetechnologies.com.
summary: The Business Analyst translates business requirements into structured documentation, ensuring clarity and traceability across development. Requires 2-5 years in BRD/SRS creation and version control.

job_title: Senior Solution Architect / Principal Solution Architect
job_description:
About Techversant

Techversant is a global technology services and solutions company providing high-quality end-to-end IT Solutions and Services to its clients across the globe for more than 17 years. Techversant specializes in Digital Transformation, Investment Priorities, and Technology Disruption, offering expertise in domains like ColdFusion, Python, Java, .NET, Node JS, Ruby on Rails, Golang, PHP, Artificial Intelligence, Blockchain, iOS, Android, Flutter, React Native, Angular, React, Vue, etc., catering to various industry verticals globally.

What’s Important to Us

Techversant is seeking a highly experienced Solution Architect who will serve as the technical authority and go-to person for complex engineering challenges. This role requires deep expertise across multiple programming languages, architecture styles, cloud platforms, and AI-driven solutions. The ideal candidate will work closely with engineering and leadership teams to design scalable, secure, and future-ready systems.

Experience

  • 10–15 years of overall software engineering and architecture experience

Key Responsibilities

Architecture & Design

  • Define and own end-to-end solution architecture for large-scale, mission-critical systems.
  • Design systems using Microservices, Event-driven architecture, Serverless, Monolithic-to-modernization patterns.
  • Apply design patterns and enterprise integration patterns to solve complex technical problems.
  • Ensure architectural decisions align with scalability, security, performance, and cost optimization goals.

Technical Leadership

  • Act as the primary technical point for engineering teams.
  • Mentor senior engineers and associate architects on architecture best practices.
  • Review and approve solution designs, high-level designs (HLD), and low-level designs (LLD).
  • Drive architectural governance, standards, and best practices across teams.

Cloud & Platform Engineering

  • Design and implement solutions on major cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP).
  • Guide teams on containerization, orchestration, and CI/CD strategies.

Emerging Technologies

  • Evaluate emerging technologies and recommend adoption where they add business value.

Collaboration & Stakeholder Engagement

  • Work closely with managers, engineering leaders, security teams, and business stakeholders.
  • Translate business requirements into scalable and secure technical solutions.
  • Communicate complex technical concepts clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences.

Programming & Development

  • Strong hands-on experience with Java, Python, C#, JavaScript/TypeScript, React, Angular.
  • Deep understanding of OO design principles, SOLID principles, and clean architecture.

Architecture & Patterns

  • Proven experience in Design patterns, Distributed systems design, API-first and domain-driven design (DDD), Messaging and event streaming systems.

Cloud & DevOps

  • Experience in at least one major cloud platform: AWS / Azure / GCP.
  • Containers (Docker), Orchestration (Kubernetes), CI/CD pipelines, Infrastructure as Code (Terraform, ARM, CloudFormation).

Security & Reliability

  • Strong understanding of IAM and access control, Encryption and data protection, Secure API design, Compliance and audit requirements.
  • Experience designing highly reliable and resilient systems.

Soft Skills & Leadership

  • Recognized as a problem solver and technical authority.
  • Strong analytical and decision-making skills.
  • Ability to challenge ideas constructively and defend architectural choices.
  • Excellent communication, documentation, and stakeholder management skills.

What We Offer

  • Excellent career growth opportunities and exposure to multiple technologies.
  • Fixed weekday day schedule (weekends off).
  • Family Medical Insurance.
  • Unique leave benefits and encashment options based on performance.
  • Long-term growth opportunities.
  • Fun family environment surrounded by experienced developers.
  • Various internal employee rewards programs based on performance.
  • Opportunities for bonus programs (training hours, certifications, innovation).
  • Work-life balance: flexible work timings, early out Fridays, social/cultural activities.
  • Company-sponsored international tours.

Contact: Share your updated resume at careers@techversantinfotech.com.
summary: Senior/Principal Solution Architect with 10–15 years of experience leading technical decisions, cloud platforms, and mentoring teams to design scalable systems.

We are seeking a proactive and technically skilled DevOps Engineer to support and manage the infrastructure and platforms powering our E-Invoicing and Integration Solutions. The ideal candidate will work closely with development, QA, security, and support teams to enable reliable application delivery while maintaining high availability and operational efficiency in compliance with UAE regulatory and interoperability requirements.

  3. Ensure availability, reliability, and performance of application and platform services.
  4. Assist in capacity planning, resource utilization, and performance optimization.

  5. Perform routine system maintenance, patching, and upgrades.

  6. CI/CD & Deployment Support

  7. Implement and maintain automated build and deployment pipelines.
  8. Support application deployments, releases, rollbacks, and configuration changes.
  9. Collaborate with development teams to streamline deployment workflows.

  10. Ensure consistency across development, testing, staging, and production environments.

  11. Containerization & Automation

  12. Deploy and manage containerized applications.
  13. Support container lifecycle management and image versioning.
  14. Assist in automating operational tasks using scripts and DevOps tools.

Why Join Us?

  • Design scalable automation solutions for network provisioning, configuration, policy enforcement, drift detection, and compliance reporting.

  • Build and standardize IaC patterns using Terraform and Ansible (modules, roles, collections, inventories).
  • Implement model-driven network automation using NETCONF and YANG (RESTCONF exposure is a plus).
  • Design Jinja template-driven configuration generation and enforce “golden configuration” standards.
  • Architect and build microservice-based network automation applications, including REST/gRPC APIs, async execution, idempotency, and retry strategies.
  • Expose automation workflows through secure APIs for provisioning, change execution, audits, and compliance checks.
  • Integrate automation workflows with CI/CD pipelines, including approvals, testing, validation, and rollback mechanisms.
  • Ensure all solutions meet security, auditability, and compliance requirements, preferably aligned with banking-grade practices.
  • Mentor engineers, conduct design and code reviews, and drive automation and engineering best practices across the team.

Required Skills

  • 10–12+ years of experience in Networking / Infrastructure Engineering with a strong focus on automation.
  • Strong Python scripting expertise for network automation (API integrations, structured data, parsing, error handling, packaging).
  • Proven hands-on experience with Terraform and Ansible in production environments.
  • Practical experience with NETCONF and YANG for model-driven network automation.
  • Strong expertise in Jinja templating for configuration generation and standardization.
  • Hands-on experience designing and delivering microservice-based applications in the network or infrastructure domain.
  • Solid networking fundamentals (routing, switching, VLANs, VPNs, DNS/DHCP, load balancers, firewalls).
  • Strong Git practices and understanding of CI/CD pipelines for infrastructure and network changes.
  • Experience owning delivery or leading automation initiatives end-to-end.

Preferred Skills

  • Experience in banking or financial services projects, including change control, approvals, audit trails, and segregation of duties.
  • Exposure to multiple network vendor ecosystems (Cisco, Juniper, Arista, Palo Alto, Fortinet, F5, etc.).
  • Familiarity with RESTCONF, gNMI, streaming telemetry, and modern network observability patterns.
  • Experience deploying automation services using Docker and Kubernetes.
  • Knowledge of event-driven automation patterns using queues or streams (Kafka, RabbitMQ, SQS, etc.).
  • Familiarity with Source of Truth concepts and tools (IPAM, CMDB, inventory systems, configuration baselines).
  • Experience with secrets management and secure automation patterns (Vault, CyberArk, or similar).

Soft Skills

  • Strong ownership mindset with focus on delivery quality, reliability, and maintainability.
  • Ability to mentor and guide engineers, establish standards, and improve team velocity through reusable patterns.
  • Clear and confident communication with technical and non-technical stakeholders.
  • Ability to present solution options, trade-offs, and architectural decisions effectively.
  • Structured, detail-oriented, and security-conscious approach to engineering.

Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or equivalent practical experience.
  • Networking certifications (CCNP, CCIE, JNCIP, or equivalent) are a plus but not mandatory.

Contact: If this opportunity aligns with your career goals, kindly share your updated resume with us at careers@cubettech.com.

We are seeking a highly skilled Linux Administrator to join our Infrastructure Engineering team. This role is responsible for designing, maintaining, and continuously improving our intercontinental network and Linux server environment, ensuring high availability, security, and performance across multiple global locations.   • Experience with Icinga, Puppet, Hiera, Linux KVM, Git, Facter, Ansible, or MySQL is desirable.
  • Proficiency in monitoring tools, switches, routers, firewalls, and load balancers.
  • Experience working in 24/7 operations or data center environments will be an added advantage.

  • Healthy work-life balance.

  • Health insurance coverage for family (spouse and two children).

  • Agile organizational structure offering creative freedom.
